content:
Diagnosis:
Gallbladder adenocarcinoma T4N1M1, HER2 amplified

Previous treatment:
Cycle 1-4 Gemcitabine/Cisplatin completed March 2024
Disease progression on CT April 2024

Current situation:
Rapidly progressive disease with new liver metastases and deteriorating performance status

MDT Discussion 25 April 2024:
Comprehensive review of imaging showing marked progression with new liver metastases (segments 4a, 7, and 8 largest measuring 4.2cm) and enlarging porta hepatis nodes. Primary gallbladder mass now measures 8.6cm with direct liver invasion. Recent HER2 testing on liver biopsy shows FISH amplification. Performance status deteriorated to ECOG 2. Significant right upper quadrant pain requiring increased opiate analgesia. Marked weight loss of 6kg over 8 weeks.

MDT Recommendations:
1. Switch to second-line treatment with Trastuzumab/FOLFOX given HER2 positivity
2. Urgent CT-guided biopsy of segment 7 liver lesion to confirm HER2 status in metastatic disease
3. Consider palliative radiotherapy to gallbladder mass if pain persists
4. Early palliative care involvement

Plan:
Will see in clinic next week to discuss MDT recommendations and commence second-line treatment if appropriate. Urgent CT-guided biopsy being arranged. Have requested palliative care review. Blood tests including liver function and tumour markers to be checked prior to clinic review.
